div.div:
Node-Red instance
(on Raspberry Pi or
AWS EC2)

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 118px; height: 1px; padding-top: 629px; margin-left: 564px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 312px; height: 1px; padding-top: 676px; margin-left: 5px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left; max-height: 265px; overflow: hidden;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
text-align: justify
div.span: Data frame format(both on USART2 and MQTT packet):

div.style: text-align: justify
text-align: justify
text-align: justify
div.span: (p), battery(b), light level balance(l) and servo position(s).

div.style: text-align: justify
div.span: The p, b, l readings are coming from ADC1 are in raw 10bit resolution format
The s number is for servo position and can take a defined values {0,4,5,6,7,8,9,10,11} in which:

div.style: text-align: justify
div.span: --> {4,5,6,7,8,9,10,11} are 8 positions between 0 and 180 degrees in manual servo position mode: {0; 22.5; 45; 67.5; 90; 112.5; 135; 157.5; 180 [degree]}
